intro: Sageretia thea, commonly known as the Chinese sweetroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Sageretia thea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
